terms.name: contact affiliation
terms.value: Biomolecular Mass Spectrometry and Proteomics, Bijvoet Center for Biomolecular Research and Utrecht Institute for Pharmaceutical Sciences, Utrecht University, Padualaan 8, 3584 CH Utrecht, The Netherlands

description: 1,500 proteins show more than two-fold expression changes during the different developmental steps, indicating extensive remodeling of the neuron proteome during differentiation. To demonstrate the strength of our resource, we focused on neural cell adhesion molecule 1 (NCAM1) as a regulator for dendritic outgrowth during neuronal development. The transmembrane isoform of NCAM1, NCAM180, is strongly upregulated during dendrite outgrowth, highly enriched in dendritic growth cones and interacts with a large variety of actin binding proteins. Inducing actin polymerization rescues the NCAM1 knockdown phenotype, suggesting that NCAM180 stimulates dendritic arbor development by promoting actin filament growth at the dendritic growth cone. Thus, our quantitative map of neuronal proteome dynamics will serve as a rich resource for further analyses of neurodevelopmental regulated processes.

keywords.name: submitter keyword
keywords.value: Neuronal differentiation, neuronal development, dendrite outgrowth, adhesion molecules, NCAM1, adhesion molecule, proteome, quantitative proteomics, stable isotope dimethyl labeling, mass spectrometry

terms.name: Reference
terms.value: Frese CK, Mikhaylova M, Stucchi R, Gautier V, Liu Q, Mohammed S, Heck AJ, Altelaar AF, Hoogenraad CC. Quantitative Map of Proteome Dynamics during Neuronal Differentiation. Cell Rep. 2017 Feb 7;18(6):1527-1542

title: A quantitative map of proteome dynamics during neuronal differentiation
